alert.note: Alert for Erie; Huron; Sandusky; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Huron, southeastern Seneca, Erie and southeastern Sandusky Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clyde to 7 miles southeast of Green Springs to near New Riegel. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Norwalk, Bellevue, Willard, Northern Milan, Milan, Wakeman, Bloomville, New Riegel, Monroeville, Attica, North Fairfield, Republic and Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio.
